discovery_instructions: Identify what the main item/entity is for this feature (e.g., ticket, workflow, employee, record)
Look for list/table views - the rows represent the primary entity
Check page headers and breadcrumbs for entity naming
Note the singular and plural forms used in the UI

find_trigger: Look for buttons with: + Add, + Create, + New, plus icon
Check top-right corner of the page
Look in empty state messages for create prompts
create.validation: New item appears in list with unique identifier

find_trigger: Click on any row in a list/table
Look for 'View' or eye icon buttons
Check if rows are clickable (cursor changes)
read.validation: Detail panel, modal, or page opens showing full information

find_trigger: Look for Edit button, pencil icon
Check for inline editing (click on field to edit)
Look for status change dropdowns or buttons
Check action menus (three-dot menu) for edit option
update.validation: Changes persist after save, reflected in list view

find_trigger: Look for Delete button, trash icon
Check action menus (three-dot menu) for delete option
Look for bulk delete with checkboxes
Some features use 'Archive' or 'Cancel' instead of delete
delete.validation: Item removed from list or status changed to deleted/archived

instructions: Navigate to the feature's main section
Take a full page snapshot to understand the layout
Identify the primary entity - what 'item' does this feature manage?
Find ALL clickable elements: buttons, links, tabs, dropdowns, icons
Map the navigation structure: tabs, sidebar items, breadcrumbs
Click each tab/sub-section and document what appears
Locate CRUD controls for the primary entity
Check for action menus (three-dot menus, right-click menus)
Document any modals, dialogs, slide-out panels
Identify form fields and input types when forms appear
Look for filters, search, sort, and export options
Check for bulk action controls (checkboxes, select all)
Note any settings or configuration options
discovery_targets: List/table of items with row actions

check_instructions: Navigate to Automations in the left sidebar
Click + Create workflow (or similar create button)
In trigger selection, search for this feature's name
Check if this feature appears as a trigger source
Document any trigger events found (e.g., 'item created', 'status changed')
Check Actions section for actions related to this feature
Look for 'Approval' or 'Pending Approval' status in the feature
Check if items have approval workflow indicators
Look for 'Submit for Approval' buttons or actions
Find approval settings in feature configuration
Document the approval chain (who approves what)
Test approval/rejection flow if test data available
Check for approval history or audit trail

execution_order: 1. EXPLORATION: Navigate to feature and discover all UI elements
2. IDENTIFY ENTITY: Determine what the primary item/entity is
3. CRUD TEST: Test create, read, update, delete for the primary entity
4. WORKFLOW CHECK: Verify if feature has workflow triggers/actions
5. WHAT_TO_DO: Execute specific validation tasks from payload
6. DOCUMENTATION: Capture screenshots of key screens

detected_integrations.workflow_evidence: Zendesk articles mention steps involving ticket creation for attendance regularization and integration with shift scheduler and attendance reports. Jira tickets reveal integration complexities with biometric devices, API data syncing, and attendance location validation, indicating workflow dependencies and automation triggers.

steps: Navigate to Work tab/Requests > My Tickets > Create Ticket
Fill in check-in/check-out date and time details
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Attendance regularization request is submitted and tracked successfully if company policy is enabled.

steps: Update biometric IDs individually or via bulk Excel upload
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Biometric IDs are updated precisely matching device IDs, ensuring accurate attendance tracking.

what_to_do.task: Use Attendance Reports with Shift Scheduler
steps: View actual check-in and check-out timings
Edit attendance records by clicking the Edit button
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Users can view and edit attendance data for all employees including shift employees.
Facial recognition is configured with retry limits and fallback options, and reference photos are managed properly.

steps: Give initial consent for facial recognition
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Employees can check in/out using facial recognition with retry and fallback options as per company settings.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: API integration lacks office location details in attendance reports
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Custom reports cannot display office information for API-integrated attendance punches.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Biometric data not reflecting due to high-volume log ingestion failures
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: System cannot consistently sync large batches of attendance data from third-party biometric devices.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Logs for shifts not showing due to admin panel bug
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Incomplete audit logs for shift scheduler and hrcore entities limit historical data tracking.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Manual configuration required for biometric devices
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Users must manually add devices with serial numbers and office assignments; no automatic discovery.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Attendance location validation is weak, allowing mismatched check-ins
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: System cannot prevent employees from checking in at locations different from scheduled shifts.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Fraud detection reports lack device ID metadata
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Cannot distinguish between legitimate and fraudulent check-ins when device IDs are null.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Biometric API integration documentation is unclear or outdated
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Lack of clear guidance for integrating biometric attendance systems.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Inconsistent policy enforcement for biometric vs mobile app attendance
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Biometric attendance bypasses overtime request policies causing inconsistencies.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Biometrics mass upload restricts direct Employee ID input
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Users must select employee names from dropdowns, limiting data entry flexibility.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Lack of centralized automated reporting for biometric devices
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Users must manually access Looker explore links for device metadata.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Facial recognition retry limit error handling is inconsistent
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: No standardized error screen; users redirected unexpectedly after max retries.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Flexible check-in methods allow broad geofence radius
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: System does not strictly enforce biometric-only authentication or precise location validation.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Facial recognition requires company-wide image capture
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Cannot enable facial recognition for select employees only; all must capture images.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Biometric data sync limited to one-week window
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Attendance data older than one week cannot be processed or recovered after suspension.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Facial recognition failure screen lacks intuitive retry mechanism
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Architectural constraints prevent direct retry navigation for failure scenarios.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Integration complexity varies by biometric device and client technical resources
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Not all devices integrate seamlessly; some require developer involvement.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: No standardized consent tracking for facial recognition
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: No built-in consent pop-up or management for camera access in mobile/kiosk modes.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Original biometric data upload API had performance issues
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Performance bottlenecks and looping issues before cache optimization.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Cache implementation resolved the issue; no manual refactoring needed.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Facial recognition allows blank image check-ins
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Lack of image validation creates security vulnerability allowing authentication bypass.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: UI cannot display biometric data with future timestamps
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Restricts visibility of upcoming or pre-logged attendance entries.
